alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 25 at 2:48PM PST until December 27 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Now through Saturday evening, heavy snow above 500 feet with additional snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches, and locally higher amounts to 18 inches above 2500 feet. 3 to 6 inches possible below 500 feet. * WHERE...Central Douglas County and Eastern Curry County and Josephine County including portions of Interstate 5 between Grants Pass and Curtain, portions of Highway 199 in the Illinois Valley, portions of the Tiller Highway from near Tiller to Shady Cove, and the Camas Mountain and valley area on Highway 138. * WHEN...Until 7 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A lull is expected this afternoon where warmer temperatures may melt existing snow below 1500 feet. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
